HEADLINE: Foreign Affairs Council focused on the situation in Eastern Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Council decided to strengthen sanctions against persons responsible for misappropriating Ukrainian state funds and targeted additional individuals under the assets freeze and travel ban.
TEXT: Foreign Affairs Council focused on the situation in Eastern Ukraine: The Council decided to strengthen sanctions against persons responsible for misappropriating Ukrainian state funds and targeted additional individuals under the assets freeze and travel ban.

HEADLINE: Agreement on a new set of sanctions
SUMMARY: In light of events in Eastern Ukraine and the illegal confiscation of entities in Crimea, the Council agreed on a new set of sanctions and took note of the preparatory work done by the Commission and Member States on possible targeted measures, as requested by the European Council in March.
TEXT: Agreement on a new set of sanctions: In light of events in Eastern Ukraine and the illegal confiscation of entities in Crimea, the Council agreed on a new set of sanctions and took note of the preparatory work done by the Commission and Member States on possible targeted measures, as requested by the European Council in March.

HEADLINE: Import ban on goods from Crimea
SUMMARY: The Council adopted measures to implement the EU's policy of non-recognition of the illegal annexation of Crimea and decided on a ban on goods originating from Crimea or Sevastopol.
TEXT: Import ban on goods from Crimea: The Council adopted measures to implement the EU's policy of non-recognition of the illegal annexation of Crimea and decided on a ban on goods originating from Crimea or Sevastopol.

HEADLINE: European Council conclusions
SUMMARY: EU leaders set out four specific steps to be taken by Russia and the separatists for de-escalation. They also signed the Association Agreement with Ukraine.
TEXT: European Council conclusions: EU leaders set out four specific steps to be taken by Russia and the separatists for de-escalation. They also signed the Association Agreement with Ukraine.

HEADLINE: Special meeting of the European Council
SUMMARY: EU leaders regretted that Russia and the separatists had not taken the requested steps set out in the June European Council conclusions. They agreed to target Russia with a new set of 6 restrictive measures including restriction on economic cooperation with Russia.
TEXT: Special meeting of the European Council: EU leaders regretted that Russia and the separatists had not taken the requested steps set out in the June European Council conclusions. They agreed to target Russia with a new set of 6 restrictive measures including restriction on economic cooperation with Russia.

HEADLINE: Ukraine crisis: EU broadens remit of sanctions
SUMMARY: The Council widened the legal basis for EU restrictive measures making it possible to target entities which materially or financially support actions against Ukraine.
TEXT: Ukraine crisis: EU broadens remit of sanctions: The Council widened the legal basis for EU restrictive measures making it possible to target entities which materially or financially support actions against Ukraine.

HEADLINE: Council takes action following the downing of flight MH17
SUMMARY: EU ministers discussed the situation in Ukraine following the downing of flight MH17. They asked to finalise preparatory work for economic sanctions in four sectors, paving the way for their adoption.
TEXT: Council takes action following the downing of flight MH17: EU ministers discussed the situation in Ukraine following the downing of flight MH17. They asked to finalise preparatory work for economic sanctions in four sectors, paving the way for their adoption.

HEADLINE: Further EU sanctions over situation in Eastern Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Council adopted reinforced EU sanctions. The Council's Committee of Permanent Representatives (Coreper) also discussed the preparatory work on further targeted measures.
TEXT: Further EU sanctions over situation in Eastern Ukraine: The Council adopted reinforced EU sanctions. The Council's Committee of Permanent Representatives (Coreper) also discussed the preparatory work on further targeted measures.

HEADLINE: Adoption of additional restrictive measures against Russia
SUMMARY: Following the conclusions of the European Council meeting of 16 July, the Council adopted a package of targeted 'economic sanctions'. These measures concern exchanges with Russia in specific economic sectors.
TEXT: Adoption of additional restrictive measures against Russia: Following the conclusions of the European Council meeting of 16 July, the Council adopted a package of targeted 'economic sanctions'. These measures concern exchanges with Russia in specific economic sectors.

HEADLINE: Special meeting of the European Council
SUMMARY: Following the dramatic escalation of the situation, with the presence and actions of Russian armed forces on the Ukrainian territory, the European Council asked for the preparation of new economic sanctions against Russia.
TEXT: Special meeting of the European Council: Following the dramatic escalation of the situation, with the presence and actions of Russian armed forces on the Ukrainian territory, the European Council asked for the preparation of new economic sanctions against Russia.

HEADLINE: Further economic sanctions on Russia
SUMMARY: A new package of restrictive measures targeting exchanges with Russia in specific economic sectors entered into force, reinforcing the measures adopted on 31 July.
TEXT: Further economic sanctions on Russia: A new package of restrictive measures targeting exchanges with Russia in specific economic sectors entered into force, reinforcing the measures adopted on 31 July.

HEADLINE: New sanctions under consideration
SUMMARY: Ukraine was the main focus of the Foreign Affairs Council. EU ministers asked the European External Action Service (EEAS) and the European Commission to present a proposal on further sanctions against separatists.
TEXT: New sanctions under consideration: Ukraine was the main focus of the Foreign Affairs Council. EU ministers asked the European External Action Service (EEAS) and the European Commission to present a proposal on further sanctions against separatists.

HEADLINE: EU strengthens sanctions against separatists in Eastern Ukraine
SUMMARY: As requested by the Foreign Affairs Council of 17 November, an asset freeze and an EU travel ban were imposed to 13 persons and five entities involved in action against Ukraine's territorial integrity. This decision brought the total of persons subject to EU sanctions over Ukraine's territorial integrity to 132 and the number of entities under EU asset freeze to 28.
TEXT: EU strengthens sanctions against separatists in Eastern Ukraine: As requested by the Foreign Affairs Council of 17 November, an asset freeze and an EU travel ban were imposed to 13 persons and five entities involved in action against Ukraine's territorial integrity. This decision brought the total of persons subject to EU sanctions over Ukraine's territorial integrity to 132 and the number of entities under EU asset freeze to 28.

HEADLINE: European Council focused on the eastern neighbourhood
SUMMARY: EU leaders discussed the situation on the eastern borders of Europe, support to Ukraine and relations with Russia. They welcomed the strengthening of the sanctions on investment, services and trade with Crimea and Sevastopol.
TEXT: European Council focused on the eastern neighbourhood: EU leaders discussed the situation on the eastern borders of Europe, support to Ukraine and relations with Russia. They welcomed the strengthening of the sanctions on investment, services and trade with Crimea and Sevastopol.

HEADLINE: Extension of existing individual restrictive measures
SUMMARY: The Council strongly condemned the indiscriminate shelling of the residential areas, especially in Mariupol, and the escalation of fighting in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions of Ukraine. In response to those events, the Council agreed to extend the existing individual restrictive measures, targeting 132 persons and 28 entities for threatening or undermining Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity, until September 2015. It also called for a proposal on additional designations for decision at the Foreign Affairs Council on 9 February 2015.
TEXT: Extension of existing individual restrictive measures: The Council strongly condemned the indiscriminate shelling of the residential areas, especially in Mariupol, and the escalation of fighting in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions of Ukraine. In response to those events, the Council agreed to extend the existing individual restrictive measures, targeting 132 persons and 28 entities for threatening or undermining Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity, until September 2015. It also called for a proposal on additional designations for decision at the Foreign Affairs Council on 9 February 2015.

HEADLINE: Additional listings on hold
SUMMARY: The Council unanimously adopted additional listings concerning separatists in Eastern Ukraine and their supporters in Russia. These consist of an asset freeze and a travel ban on 19 persons and 9 entities involved in action against Ukraine's territorial integrity. To give space for diplomatic efforts and the Minsk talks, the Council put the entry into force of the measures on hold until Monday 16 February 2015.
TEXT: Additional listings on hold: The Council unanimously adopted additional listings concerning separatists in Eastern Ukraine and their supporters in Russia. These consist of an asset freeze and a travel ban on 19 persons and 9 entities involved in action against Ukraine's territorial integrity. To give space for diplomatic efforts and the Minsk talks, the Council put the entry into force of the measures on hold until Monday 16 February 2015.

HEADLINE: EU leaders welcomed the results of the Minsk agreement
SUMMARY: At an informal meeting of heads of state or government, EU leaders gave cautious support to the Minsk agreement. They indicated that they will not hesitate to take the necessary steps if the agreement is not implemented and the ceasefire is not respected.
TEXT: EU leaders welcomed the results of the Minsk agreement: At an informal meeting of heads of state or government, EU leaders gave cautious support to the Minsk agreement. They indicated that they will not hesitate to take the necessary steps if the agreement is not implemented and the ceasefire is not respected.

HEADLINE: EU strengthens sanctions against separatists in Eastern Ukraine
SUMMARY: As requested by the Foreign Affairs Council of 9 February, an asset freeze and an EU travel ban were imposed to 19 persons and 9 entities involved in action against Ukraine's territorial integrity.
TEXT: EU strengthens sanctions against separatists in Eastern Ukraine: As requested by the Foreign Affairs Council of 9 February, an asset freeze and an EU travel ban were imposed to 19 persons and 9 entities involved in action against Ukraine's territorial integrity.

HEADLINE: Extension of EU sanctions over misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds
SUMMARY: The Council adjusted and extended EU restrictive measures focused on the freezing and recovery of misappropriated Ukrainian state funds.
TEXT: Extension of EU sanctions over misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds: The Council adjusted and extended EU restrictive measures focused on the freezing and recovery of misappropriated Ukrainian state funds.

HEADLINE: Extension of EU sanctions over action against Ukraine's territorial integrity
SUMMARY: The Council extended until 15 September 2015 the application of EU restrictive measures targeting action against Ukraine's sovereignty, territorial integrity and independence. 150 persons and 37 entities are subject to asset freeze and travel bans under these sanctions.
TEXT: Extension of EU sanctions over action against Ukraine's territorial integrity: The Council extended until 15 September 2015 the application of EU restrictive measures targeting action against Ukraine's sovereignty, territorial integrity and independence. 150 persons and 37 entities are subject to asset freeze and travel bans under these sanctions.

HEADLINE: European Council
SUMMARY: Leaders decided to align the existing sanctions regime to the implementation of the Minsk agreements. Economic sanctions will remain enforced until the end of 2015 when the last point of the peace plan is to be implemented: Ukraine regaining control over its borders in the east. EU leaders also stressed the need to challenge Russia's ongoing campaign of public disinformation about the conflict in Ukraine. The EU High Representative, Federica Mogherini, was invited to prepare an action plan on strategic communication for the June European Council. EU leaders agreed on the objectives of the Eastern Partnership summit, which then took place in Riga on 21-22 May 2015. The European Council repeated its commitment to the eastern partners and set as a priority to strengthen the democratic institutions to the east.
TEXT: European Council: Leaders decided to align the existing sanctions regime to the implementation of the Minsk agreements. Economic sanctions will remain enforced until the end of 2015 when the last point of the peace plan is to be implemented: Ukraine regaining control over its borders in the east. EU leaders also stressed the need to challenge Russia's ongoing campaign of public disinformation about the conflict in Ukraine. The EU High Representative, Federica Mogherini, was invited to prepare an action plan on strategic communication for the June European Council. EU leaders agreed on the objectives of the Eastern Partnership summit, which then took place in Riga on 21-22 May 2015. The European Council repeated its commitment to the eastern partners and set as a priority to strengthen the democratic institutions to the east.

HEADLINE: Extension of EU sanctions over misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds
SUMMARY: The Council extended the asset freeze for three persons covered by measures applying until 6 June 2015.
TEXT: Extension of EU sanctions over misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds: The Council extended the asset freeze for three persons covered by measures applying until 6 June 2015.

HEADLINE: Extension of restrictions in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol
SUMMARY: The Council extended until 23 June 2016 the EU restrictive measures in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol. These measures include prohibitions on import of products, investment, tourism services and exports of certain goods and technologies.
TEXT: Extension of restrictions in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol: The Council extended until 23 June 2016 the EU restrictive measures in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol. These measures include prohibitions on import of products, investment, tourism services and exports of certain goods and technologies.

HEADLINE: Extension of economic sanctions
SUMMARY: The Council extended EU economic sanctions until 31 January 2016. These sanctions were introduced in response to Russia's destabilising role in Eastern Ukraine. They target certain exchanges with Russia in the financial, energy and defence sectors and dual-use goods.
TEXT: Extension of economic sanctions: The Council extended EU economic sanctions until 31 January 2016. These sanctions were introduced in response to Russia's destabilising role in Eastern Ukraine. They target certain exchanges with Russia in the financial, energy and defence sectors and dual-use goods.

HEADLINE: Extension of EU sanctions over action against Ukraine's territorial integrity
SUMMARY: The Council extended until 15 March 2016 the application of EU restrictive measures targeting action against Ukraine's territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence. 149 persons and 37 entities are subject to asset freeze and travel bans under these sanctions.
TEXT: Extension of EU sanctions over action against Ukraine's territorial integrity: The Council extended until 15 March 2016 the application of EU restrictive measures targeting action against Ukraine's territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence. 149 persons and 37 entities are subject to asset freeze and travel bans under these sanctions.

HEADLINE: Extension of EU sanctions over misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds
SUMMARY: The Council extended the asset freeze for one person covered by measures applying until 6 October 2015.
TEXT: Extension of EU sanctions over misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds: The Council extended the asset freeze for one person covered by measures applying until 6 October 2015.

HEADLINE: Extension of economic sanctions
SUMMARY: The Council prolonged EU economic sanctions against Russia until 31 July 2016. In March 2015, EU leaders decided to align the existing sanctions regime to the complete implementation of the Minsk agreements, which was foreseen for the end of December 2015. Since the Minsk agreements will not be fully implemented by 31 December 2015, the duration of the sanctions has been prolonged whilst the Council continues its assessment of progress in implementation.
TEXT: Extension of economic sanctions: The Council prolonged EU economic sanctions against Russia until 31 July 2016. In March 2015, EU leaders decided to align the existing sanctions regime to the complete implementation of the Minsk agreements, which was foreseen for the end of December 2015. Since the Minsk agreements will not be fully implemented by 31 December 2015, the duration of the sanctions has been prolonged whilst the Council continues its assessment of progress in implementation.

HEADLINE: Extension of EU sanctions over misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds
SUMMARY: The Council extended by one year asset freezes against 16 people identified as responsible for the misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds or for the abuse of office causing a loss to Ukrainian public funds.
TEXT: Extension of EU sanctions over misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds: The Council extended by one year asset freezes against 16 people identified as responsible for the misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds or for the abuse of office causing a loss to Ukrainian public funds.

HEADLINE: Extension of EU sanctions over action against Ukraine's territorial integrity
SUMMARY: The Council extended until 15 September 2016 EU restrictive measures against 146 people and 37 companies, in view of the continuing undermining or threatening of the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.
TEXT: Extension of EU sanctions over action against Ukraine's territorial integrity: The Council extended until 15 September 2016 EU restrictive measures against 146 people and 37 companies, in view of the continuing undermining or threatening of the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

HEADLINE: Extension of sanctions in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol
SUMMARY: The Council extended the restrictive measures in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol by Russia until 23 June 2017. The measures apply to EU persons and EU based companies. They are limited to the territory of Crimea and Sevastopol.
TEXT: Extension of sanctions in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol: The Council extended the restrictive measures in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol by Russia until 23 June 2017. The measures apply to EU persons and EU based companies. They are limited to the territory of Crimea and Sevastopol.

HEADLINE: Extension of economic sanctions
SUMMARY: The Council prolonged the economic sanctions targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy until 31 January 2017. In July 2016, having assessed the implementation of the Minsk agreements, the Council decided to renew the sanctions for a further six months.
TEXT: Extension of economic sanctions: The Council prolonged the economic sanctions targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy until 31 January 2017. In July 2016, having assessed the implementation of the Minsk agreements, the Council decided to renew the sanctions for a further six months.

HEADLINE: EU adds six members of the State Duma from Crimea to sanctions list
SUMMARY: The EU added six members of the Russian Federation State Duma elected from the illegally annexed Autonomous Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol to the list of persons subject to restrictive measures in respect of actions undermining Ukraine's territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence.
TEXT: EU adds six members of the State Duma from Crimea to sanctions list: The EU added six members of the Russian Federation State Duma elected from the illegally annexed Autonomous Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol to the list of persons subject to restrictive measures in respect of actions undermining Ukraine's territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence.

HEADLINE: Extension of economic sanctions
SUMMARY: The Council extended the application of economic sanctions targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy, until 31 July 2017. This was decided following the European Council meeting on 15 December 2016, where the leaders assessed the progress in implementing the Minsk agreements and paved the way for a further extension of sanctions.
TEXT: Extension of economic sanctions: The Council extended the application of economic sanctions targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy, until 31 July 2017. This was decided following the European Council meeting on 15 December 2016, where the leaders assessed the progress in implementing the Minsk agreements and paved the way for a further extension of sanctions.

HEADLINE: Extension of EU sanctions over misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds
SUMMARY: The Council extended until 6 March 2018 the asset freezes against 15 people identified as responsible for the misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds or for the abuse of office causing a loss to Ukrainian public funds.
TEXT: Extension of EU sanctions over misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds: The Council extended until 6 March 2018 the asset freezes against 15 people identified as responsible for the misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds or for the abuse of office causing a loss to Ukrainian public funds.

HEADLINE: Extension of EU sanctions over actions against Ukraine's territorial integrity
SUMMARY: The Council prolonged for a further six months, until 15 September 2017, the application of sanctions targeting actions against Ukraine's territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence. The measures consist of asset freezes and a travel ban applying to 150 people and 37 entities.
TEXT: Extension of EU sanctions over actions against Ukraine's territorial integrity: The Council prolonged for a further six months, until 15 September 2017, the application of sanctions targeting actions against Ukraine's territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence. The measures consist of asset freezes and a travel ban applying to 150 people and 37 entities.

HEADLINE: Extension of sanctions in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol
SUMMARY: The Council extended the restrictive measures in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol by Russia until 23 June 2018. The measures apply to EU persons and EU based companies. They are limited to the territory of Crimea and Sevastopol.
TEXT: Extension of sanctions in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol: The Council extended the restrictive measures in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol by Russia until 23 June 2018. The measures apply to EU persons and EU based companies. They are limited to the territory of Crimea and Sevastopol.

HEADLINE: Extension of economic sanctions
SUMMARY: The Council prolonged economic sanctions targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy until 31 January 2018. This decision follows an update from President Macron and Chancellor Merkel to the European Council of 22-23 June 2017 on the implementation of the Minsk Agreements.
TEXT: Extension of economic sanctions: The Council prolonged economic sanctions targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy until 31 January 2018. This decision follows an update from President Macron and Chancellor Merkel to the European Council of 22-23 June 2017 on the implementation of the Minsk Agreements.

HEADLINE: EU adds 3 persons and 3 companies to sanctions list
SUMMARY: The EU has added 3 Russian nationals and 3 companies involved in the transfer of gas turbines to Crimea to the list of persons subject to restrictive measures in respect of actions undermining Ukraine's territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence.
TEXT: EU adds 3 persons and 3 companies to sanctions list: The EU has added 3 Russian nationals and 3 companies involved in the transfer of gas turbines to Crimea to the list of persons subject to restrictive measures in respect of actions undermining Ukraine's territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence.

HEADLINE: Extension of EU sanctions over actions against Ukraine's territorial integrity
SUMMARY: The Council prolonged for a further six months, until 15 March 2018, the application of sanctions targeting actions against Ukraine's territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence. The restrictive measures now apply to 149 persons and 38 entities.
TEXT: Extension of EU sanctions over actions against Ukraine's territorial integrity: The Council prolonged for a further six months, until 15 March 2018, the application of sanctions targeting actions against Ukraine's territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence. The restrictive measures now apply to 149 persons and 38 entities.

HEADLINE: "Governor of Sevastopol" added to sanctions list over actions against Ukraine's territorial integrity
SUMMARY: The Council added Dmitry Vladimirovich Ovsyannikov, "Governor of Sevastopol", to the list of those submitted to restrictive measures over actions undermining or threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. The restrictive measures now apply to 150 persons and 38 entities.
TEXT: "Governor of Sevastopol" added to sanctions list over actions against Ukraine's territorial integrity: The Council added Dmitry Vladimirovich Ovsyannikov, "Governor of Sevastopol", to the list of those submitted to restrictive measures over actions undermining or threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. The restrictive measures now apply to 150 persons and 38 entities.

HEADLINE: Extension of economic sanctions
SUMMARY: The Council prolonged economic sanctions targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy until 31 July 2018. This decision follows an update from President Macron and Chancellor Merkel to the European Council of 14 December 2017 on the state of implementation of the Minsk agreements.
TEXT: Extension of economic sanctions: The Council prolonged economic sanctions targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy until 31 July 2018. This decision follows an update from President Macron and Chancellor Merkel to the European Council of 14 December 2017 on the state of implementation of the Minsk agreements.

HEADLINE: Extension of EU sanctions over misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds
SUMMARY: The Council extended until 6 March 2019 the asset freezes against 13 people identified as responsible for the misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds or for the abuse of office causing a loss to Ukrainian public funds. The restrictive measures against two persons were not extended. This decision was based on the annual review of the measures.
TEXT: Extension of EU sanctions over misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds: The Council extended until 6 March 2019 the asset freezes against 13 people identified as responsible for the misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds or for the abuse of office causing a loss to Ukrainian public funds. The restrictive measures against two persons were not extended. This decision was based on the annual review of the measures.

HEADLINE: Extension of EU sanctions over actions against Ukraine's territorial integrity
SUMMARY: The Council prolonged for a further six months, until 15 September 2018, the application of sanctions targeting actions against Ukraine's territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence. The measures consist of asset freezes and a travel ban applying to 150 people and 38 entities.
TEXT: Extension of EU sanctions over actions against Ukraine's territorial integrity: The Council prolonged for a further six months, until 15 September 2018, the application of sanctions targeting actions against Ukraine's territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence. The measures consist of asset freezes and a travel ban applying to 150 people and 38 entities.

HEADLINE: EU adds five people involved in the organisation of Russian presidential elections to sanctions list
SUMMARY: The EU has added five people to the sanction list for their involvement in the organisation of Russian presidential elections in illegally annexed Crimea and Sevastopol. Thereby these individuals actively supported and implemented policies that undermine the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.
TEXT: EU adds five people involved in the organisation of Russian presidential elections to sanctions list: The EU has added five people to the sanction list for their involvement in the organisation of Russian presidential elections in illegally annexed Crimea and Sevastopol. Thereby these individuals actively supported and implemented policies that undermine the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

HEADLINE: Extension of sanctions in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol
SUMMARY: The Council extended the restrictive measures in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol by Russia until 23 June 2019.
TEXT: Extension of sanctions in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol: The Council extended the restrictive measures in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol by Russia until 23 June 2019.

HEADLINE: Extension of economic sanctions
SUMMARY: The Council prolonged economic sanctions targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy until 31 January 2019. This decision follows an update from President Macron and Chancellor Merkel to the European Council of 28-29 June 2018 on the state of implementation of the Minsk agreements.
TEXT: Extension of economic sanctions: The Council prolonged economic sanctions targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy until 31 January 2019. This decision follows an update from President Macron and Chancellor Merkel to the European Council of 28-29 June 2018 on the state of implementation of the Minsk agreements.

HEADLINE: EU adds 6 entities involved in the construction of the Kerch Bridge to sanctions list
SUMMARY: The EU added six entities to the sanctions list because of their involvement in the construction of the Kerch Bridge, connecting Russia to the illegally annexed Crimean peninsula. Through their actions they supported the consolidation of Russia's control over the illegally annexed Crimean peninsula, which in turn further undermines the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.
TEXT: EU adds 6 entities involved in the construction of the Kerch Bridge to sanctions list: The EU added six entities to the sanctions list because of their involvement in the construction of the Kerch Bridge, connecting Russia to the illegally annexed Crimean peninsula. Through their actions they supported the consolidation of Russia's control over the illegally annexed Crimean peninsula, which in turn further undermines the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.

HEADLINE: EU extends sanctions over action against Ukraine's territorial integrity
SUMMARY: The Council has extended the EU restrictive measures for a further six months, until 15 March 2019. The measures consist of asset freezes and travel restrictions. They currently apply to 155 persons and 44 entities.
TEXT: EU extends sanctions over action against Ukraine's territorial integrity: The Council has extended the EU restrictive measures for a further six months, until 15 March 2019. The measures consist of asset freezes and travel restrictions. They currently apply to 155 persons and 44 entities.

HEADLINE: EU adds nine people to sanctions list for their involvement in the so-called elections of 11 November 2018
SUMMARY: The Council added nine persons involved in the so-called "elections" 11 November 2018, which the EU considers as illegal and illegitimate, to the list of those subject to restrictive measures over actions undermining or threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine
TEXT: EU adds nine people to sanctions list for their involvement in the so-called elections of 11 November 2018: The Council added nine persons involved in the so-called "elections" 11 November 2018, which the EU considers as illegal and illegitimate, to the list of those subject to restrictive measures over actions undermining or threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine

HEADLINE: Extension of economic sanctions
SUMMARY: The Council prolonged economic sanctions targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy until 31 July 2019. This decision follows an update from President Macron and Chancellor Merkel to the European Council of 13-14 December 2018 on the state of implementation of the Minsk agreements.
TEXT: Extension of economic sanctions: The Council prolonged economic sanctions targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy until 31 July 2019. This decision follows an update from President Macron and Chancellor Merkel to the European Council of 13-14 December 2018 on the state of implementation of the Minsk agreements.

HEADLINE: Extension of EU sanctions over misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds
SUMMARY: The Council extended until 6 March 2020 the asset freezes against 12 people identified as responsible for the misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds or for the abuse of office causing a loss to Ukrainian public funds. The restrictive measures against one person were not extended. This decision was based on the annual review of the measures.
TEXT: Extension of EU sanctions over misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds: The Council extended until 6 March 2020 the asset freezes against 12 people identified as responsible for the misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds or for the abuse of office causing a loss to Ukrainian public funds. The restrictive measures against one person were not extended. This decision was based on the annual review of the measures.

HEADLINE: EU responds to escalation at the Kerch Strait and the Sea of Azov, and renews sanctions over actions against Ukraine's territorial integrity
SUMMARY: The Council added eight Russian officials to the list of those subject to restrictive measures in respect of actions undermining or threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. These new listings have been adopted by the Council as a response to escalation in the Kerch Strait and the Sea of Azov and the violations of international law by Russia, which used military force with no justification.
TEXT: EU responds to escalation at the Kerch Strait and the Sea of Azov, and renews sanctions over actions against Ukraine's territorial integrity: The Council added eight Russian officials to the list of those subject to restrictive measures in respect of actions undermining or threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. These new listings have been adopted by the Council as a response to escalation in the Kerch Strait and the Sea of Azov and the violations of international law by Russia, which used military force with no justification.

HEADLINE: Extension of sanctions in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol
SUMMARY: The Council extended the restrictive measures in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol by Russia until 23 June 2020.
TEXT: Extension of sanctions in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol: The Council extended the restrictive measures in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol by Russia until 23 June 2020.

HEADLINE: Extension of economic sanctions
SUMMARY: The Council prolonged economic sanctions targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy until 31 January 2020. This decision follows an update from President Macron and Chancellor Merkel to the European Council of 20-21 June 2019 on the state of implementation of the Minsk agreements.
TEXT: Extension of economic sanctions: The Council prolonged economic sanctions targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy until 31 January 2020. This decision follows an update from President Macron and Chancellor Merkel to the European Council of 20-21 June 2019 on the state of implementation of the Minsk agreements.

HEADLINE: EU extends sanctions over action against Ukraine's territorial integrity
SUMMARY: The Council has extended the EU restrictive measures for a further six months, until 15 March 2020. The measures consist of asset freezes and travel restrictions. They currently apply to 170 persons and 44 entities.
TEXT: EU extends sanctions over action against Ukraine's territorial integrity: The Council has extended the EU restrictive measures for a further six months, until 15 March 2020. The measures consist of asset freezes and travel restrictions. They currently apply to 170 persons and 44 entities.

HEADLINE: Extension of economic sanctions
SUMMARY: The Council prolonged the economic sanctions targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy until 31 July 2020. This decision follows an update by President Macron and Chancellor Merkel to the European Council, on 12 December 2019, on the state of implementation of the Minsk agreements, to which the decision on maintaining sanctions is linked.
TEXT: Extension of economic sanctions: The Council prolonged the economic sanctions targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy until 31 July 2020. This decision follows an update by President Macron and Chancellor Merkel to the European Council, on 12 December 2019, on the state of implementation of the Minsk agreements, to which the decision on maintaining sanctions is linked.

HEADLINE: Extension of EU sanctions over misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds
SUMMARY: The Council decided to prolong for one more year until 6 March 2021 the existing asset freezes directed against 10 persons identified as responsible for the misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds or for the abuse of office causing a loss to Ukrainian public funds. The restrictive measures against two persons were not extended.
TEXT: Extension of EU sanctions over misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds: The Council decided to prolong for one more year until 6 March 2021 the existing asset freezes directed against 10 persons identified as responsible for the misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds or for the abuse of office causing a loss to Ukrainian public funds. The restrictive measures against two persons were not extended.

HEADLINE: EU extends sanctions over action against Ukraine's territorial integrity
SUMMARY: The Council decided that current sanctions in respect of actions undermining or threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine should be extended for a further six months until 15 September 2020. These restrictive measures provide not only for a freezing of funds, but also a prohibition against making funds or other economic resources available to the listed persons. They currently apply to 175 persons and 44 entities, following the removal of two deceased persons from the list.
TEXT: EU extends sanctions over action against Ukraine's territorial integrity: The Council decided that current sanctions in respect of actions undermining or threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine should be extended for a further six months until 15 September 2020. These restrictive measures provide not only for a freezing of funds, but also a prohibition against making funds or other economic resources available to the listed persons. They currently apply to 175 persons and 44 entities, following the removal of two deceased persons from the list.

HEADLINE: Extension of sanctions in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol
SUMMARY: The Council decided to renew the sanctions introduced in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol by the Russian Federation until 23 June 2021.
TEXT: Extension of sanctions in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol: The Council decided to renew the sanctions introduced in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol by the Russian Federation until 23 June 2021.

HEADLINE: EU renews economic sanctions over Ukrainian crisis for six more months
SUMMARY: The Council decided to renew the sanctions targeting specific economic sectors of the Russian Federation for a further six months, until 31 January 2021.
TEXT: EU renews economic sanctions over Ukrainian crisis for six more months: The Council decided to renew the sanctions targeting specific economic sectors of the Russian Federation for a further six months, until 31 January 2021.

HEADLINE: Two persons and four entities added to EU sanctions list
SUMMARY: The Council added two individuals and four entities to the list of those individuals and entities subject to restrictive measures in respect of actions undermining or threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. These measures were adopted in the light of the role played by these people and entities in the construction of the bridge and railway tracks linking Russia to the illegally annexed Crimean peninsula via the Kerch Strait, and further isolating Crimea from Ukraine.
TEXT: Two persons and four entities added to EU sanctions list: The Council added two individuals and four entities to the list of those individuals and entities subject to restrictive measures in respect of actions undermining or threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. These measures were adopted in the light of the role played by these people and entities in the construction of the bridge and railway tracks linking Russia to the illegally annexed Crimean peninsula via the Kerch Strait, and further isolating Crimea from Ukraine.

HEADLINE: The EU prolongs economic sanctions for another six months
SUMMARY: The Council decided to prolong the restrictive measures currently targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy until 31 July 2021. These sanctions were imposed in 2014 in response to Russia's actions destabilising the situation in Ukraine.
TEXT: The EU prolongs economic sanctions for another six months: The Council decided to prolong the restrictive measures currently targeting specific sectors of the Russian economy until 31 July 2021. These sanctions were imposed in 2014 in response to Russia's actions destabilising the situation in Ukraine.

HEADLINE: Misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds: EU prolongs restrictive measures
SUMMARY: The Council decided to prolong for one more year, until 6 March 2022, the existing asset freezes directed against 7 individuals identified as responsible for the misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds or for the abuse of office causing a loss to Ukrainian public funds. The restrictive measures against one person were prolonged until 6 September 2021, and those against two persons were not extended.
TEXT: Misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds: EU prolongs restrictive measures: The Council decided to prolong for one more year, until 6 March 2022, the existing asset freezes directed against 7 individuals identified as responsible for the misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds or for the abuse of office causing a loss to Ukrainian public funds. The restrictive measures against one person were prolonged until 6 September 2021, and those against two persons were not extended.

HEADLINE: EU extends sanctions over territorial integrity for a further six months
SUMMARY: The Council decided to extend the sanctions targeting those responsible for undermining or threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine for a further six months until 15 September 2021. The existing restrictive measures provide for travel restrictions, the freezing of assets, and a ban on making funds or other economic resources available to the listed persons and entities. Sanctions will continue to apply to 177 individuals and 48 entities.
TEXT: EU extends sanctions over territorial integrity for a further six months: The Council decided to extend the sanctions targeting those responsible for undermining or threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine for a further six months until 15 September 2021. The existing restrictive measures provide for travel restrictions, the freezing of assets, and a ban on making funds or other economic resources available to the listed persons and entities. Sanctions will continue to apply to 177 individuals and 48 entities.

HEADLINE: Crimea and Sevastopol: Council renews sanctions for a further year
SUMMARY: The Council decided to renew sanctions introduced in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol by the Russian Federation for a further year until 23 June 2022.
TEXT: Crimea and Sevastopol: Council renews sanctions for a further year: The Council decided to renew sanctions introduced in response to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol by the Russian Federation for a further year until 23 June 2022.

HEADLINE: EU sanctions over territorial integrity prolonged for a further six months
SUMMARY: On 10 September 2021, the Council decided to prolong the sanctions targeting those responsible for undermining or threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine for a further six months until 15 March 2022. The existing restrictive measures provide for travel restrictions, the freezing of assets, and a ban on making funds or other economic resources available to the listed persons and entities. Sanctions will continue to apply to 177 individuals and 48 entities.
TEXT: EU sanctions over territorial integrity prolonged for a further six months: On 10 September 2021, the Council decided to prolong the sanctions targeting those responsible for undermining or threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine for a further six months until 15 March 2022. The existing restrictive measures provide for travel restrictions, the freezing of assets, and a ban on making funds or other economic resources available to the listed persons and entities. Sanctions will continue to apply to 177 individuals and 48 entities.

HEADLINE: EU sanctions eight more people over territorial integrity
SUMMARY: On 11 October, the Council decided to impose restrictive measures on an additional 8 individuals for actively supporting actions and implementing policies that undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. The persons added to the EU sanctions list include law enforcement officials - judges, prosecutors and security officers - responsible for enforcing Russian law in the illegally-annexed Crimea and Sevastopol. EU restrictive measures regarding the territorial integrity of Ukraine now apply to a total of 185 persons and 48 entities.
TEXT: EU sanctions eight more people over territorial integrity: On 11 October, the Council decided to impose restrictive measures on an additional 8 individuals for actively supporting actions and implementing policies that undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. The persons added to the EU sanctions list include law enforcement officials - judges, prosecutors and security officers - responsible for enforcing Russian law in the illegally-annexed Crimea and Sevastopol. EU restrictive measures regarding the territorial integrity of Ukraine now apply to a total of 185 persons and 48 entities.

HEADLINE: EU renews economic sanctions
SUMMARY: The EU extended existing economic sanctions against Russia for six months until 31 July 2022 following assessment of the Minsk agreements.
TEXT: EU renews economic sanctions: The EU extended existing economic sanctions against Russia for six months until 31 July 2022 following assessment of the Minsk agreements.

HEADLINE: Ukraines territorial integrity: EU sanctions five persons
SUMMARY: The EU imposed restrictive measures on five individuals supporting actions undermining Ukraines territorial integrity, including members of Russias State Duma elected from illegally annexed Crimea.
TEXT: Ukraines territorial integrity: EU sanctions five persons: The EU imposed restrictive measures on five individuals supporting actions undermining Ukraines territorial integrity, including members of Russias State Duma elected from illegally annexed Crimea.

HEADLINE: First package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU adopted its first sanctions package in response to Russias recognition of Donetsk and Luhansk regions, targeting 351 State Duma members and restricting economic relations and access to EU financial markets.
TEXT: First package of sanctions against Russia: The EU adopted its first sanctions package in response to Russias recognition of Donetsk and Luhansk regions, targeting 351 State Duma members and restricting economic relations and access to EU financial markets.

HEADLINE: EU leaders agree on further sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: EU leaders approved additional sanctions targeting Russias financial, energy, transport, and technology sectors, along with visa restrictions and new listing criteria.
TEXT: EU leaders agree on further sanctions against Russia: EU leaders approved additional sanctions targeting Russias financial, energy, transport, and technology sectors, along with visa restrictions and new listing criteria.

HEADLINE: Second package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU froze assets of President Vladimir Putin and Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov and imposed broad sanctions across finance, energy, transport, technology, and visa policy.
TEXT: Second package of sanctions against Russia: The EU froze assets of President Vladimir Putin and Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov and imposed broad sanctions across finance, energy, transport, technology, and visa policy.

HEADLINE: Third package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU banned transactions with the Russian Central Bank, closed EU airspace to Russian carriers, imposed new sanctions on individuals, and provided 500 million military support to Ukraine.
TEXT: Third package of sanctions against Russia: The EU banned transactions with the Russian Central Bank, closed EU airspace to Russian carriers, imposed new sanctions on individuals, and provided 500 million military support to Ukraine.

HEADLINE: SWIFT ban on Russian banks
SUMMARY: Seven Russian banks were excluded from the SWIFT system, and additional bans were introduced on euro banknotes, investments, and Russian Direct Investment Fund projects.
TEXT: SWIFT ban on Russian banks: Seven Russian banks were excluded from the SWIFT system, and additional bans were introduced on euro banknotes, investments, and Russian Direct Investment Fund projects.

HEADLINE: EU bans Russian state media outlets
SUMMARY: The EU suspended broadcasting of Russia Today and Sputnik within the EU for spreading disinformation supporting Russias military aggression.
TEXT: EU bans Russian state media outlets: The EU suspended broadcasting of Russia Today and Sputnik within the EU for spreading disinformation supporting Russias military aggression.

HEADLINE: Misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds: sanctions prolonged
SUMMARY: The EU extended asset freezes for one year against individuals responsible for misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds or abuse of office.
TEXT: Misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds: sanctions prolonged: The EU extended asset freezes for one year against individuals responsible for misappropriation of Ukrainian state funds or abuse of office.

HEADLINE: EU imposes restrictive measures on 160 individuals
SUMMARY: Sanctions were imposed on 160 individuals including oligarchs and Russian Federation Council members involved in Russias military aggression against Ukraine.
TEXT: EU imposes restrictive measures on 160 individuals: Sanctions were imposed on 160 individuals including oligarchs and Russian Federation Council members involved in Russias military aggression against Ukraine.

HEADLINE: EU agrees new measures targeting Belarus and Russia
SUMMARY: The EU imposed financial and trade restrictions on Belarus for its role in supporting Russian aggression, including SWIFT bans and Central Bank transaction prohibitions.
TEXT: EU agrees new measures targeting Belarus and Russia: The EU imposed financial and trade restrictions on Belarus for its role in supporting Russian aggression, including SWIFT bans and Central Bank transaction prohibitions.

HEADLINE: EU extends territorial integrity sanctions
SUMMARY: Sanctions targeting individuals and entities undermining Ukraines sovereignty were extended for six months until 15 September 2022.
TEXT: EU extends territorial integrity sanctions: Sanctions targeting individuals and entities undermining Ukraines sovereignty were extended for six months until 15 September 2022.

HEADLINE: Fourth package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU banned transactions with state-owned enterprises, restricted investments in Russias energy sector, and imposed trade restrictions on iron, steel, and luxury goods.
TEXT: Fourth package of sanctions against Russia: The EU banned transactions with state-owned enterprises, restricted investments in Russias energy sector, and imposed trade restrictions on iron, steel, and luxury goods.

HEADLINE: Fifth package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU banned coal imports, restricted Russian vessels from EU ports, banned road transport operators, limited crypto deposits, and sanctioned banks and individuals.
TEXT: Fifth package of sanctions against Russia: The EU banned coal imports, restricted Russian vessels from EU ports, banned road transport operators, limited crypto deposits, and sanctioned banks and individuals.

HEADLINE: Humanitarian exceptions to restrictive measures
SUMMARY: The EU introduced humanitarian exemptions to sanctions to facilitate aid delivery in Ukraine.
TEXT: Humanitarian exceptions to restrictive measures: The EU introduced humanitarian exemptions to sanctions to facilitate aid delivery in Ukraine.

HEADLINE: EU sanctions two businesspeople over Crimea
SUMMARY: Sanctions were imposed on Serhiy Kurchenko and Yevgeniy Prigozhin for their involvement in Crimeas illegal annexation and support of separatist activities.
TEXT: EU sanctions two businesspeople over Crimea: Sanctions were imposed on Serhiy Kurchenko and Yevgeniy Prigozhin for their involvement in Crimeas illegal annexation and support of separatist activities.

HEADLINE: European Council agrees on sixth sanctions package
SUMMARY: EU leaders agreed to ban most Russian oil imports, discussed food security, energy independence, and increased support for Ukraine.
TEXT: European Council agrees on sixth sanctions package: EU leaders agreed to ban most Russian oil imports, discussed food security, energy independence, and increased support for Ukraine.

HEADLINE: Sixth package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU banned most Russian oil imports, imposed SWIFT bans on banks, suspended broadcasting outlets, and sanctioned individuals linked to war atrocities.
TEXT: Sixth package of sanctions against Russia: The EU banned most Russian oil imports, imposed SWIFT bans on banks, suspended broadcasting outlets, and sanctioned individuals linked to war atrocities.

HEADLINE: Crimea and Sevastopol sanctions extended
SUMMARY: Sanctions related to Crimea and Sevastopol were extended for one year, restricting trade, investment, tourism, and energy exploration.
TEXT: Crimea and Sevastopol sanctions extended: Sanctions related to Crimea and Sevastopol were extended for one year, restricting trade, investment, tourism, and energy exploration.

HEADLINE: Maintenance and alignment sanctions package
SUMMARY: The EU banned Russian-origin gold imports, reinforced export controls, clarified existing measures, and sanctioned additional individuals and entities.
TEXT: Maintenance and alignment sanctions package: The EU banned Russian-origin gold imports, reinforced export controls, clarified existing measures, and sanctioned additional individuals and entities.

HEADLINE: EU renews economic sanctions
SUMMARY: Economic sanctions targeting finance, energy, transport, and luxury goods were extended until 31 January 2023.
TEXT: EU renews economic sanctions: Economic sanctions targeting finance, energy, transport, and luxury goods were extended until 31 January 2023.

HEADLINE: EU sanctions Viktor and Oleksandr Yanukovych
SUMMARY: The EU imposed restrictive measures on Viktor Yanukovych and his son for undermining Ukraines sovereignty and supporting separatist groups.
TEXT: EU sanctions Viktor and Oleksandr Yanukovych: The EU imposed restrictive measures on Viktor Yanukovych and his son for undermining Ukraines sovereignty and supporting separatist groups.

HEADLINE: EU prolongs individual sanctions
SUMMARY: Individual sanctions against persons undermining Ukraines sovereignty were extended for six months until 15 March 2023.
TEXT: EU prolongs individual sanctions: Individual sanctions against persons undermining Ukraines sovereignty were extended for six months until 15 March 2023.

HEADLINE: Eighth package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU introduced oil transport price caps, expanded restricted military items, and sanctioned additional individuals and entities.
TEXT: Eighth package of sanctions against Russia: The EU introduced oil transport price caps, expanded restricted military items, and sanctioned additional individuals and entities.

HEADLINE: EU sanctions Iranian drone suppliers
SUMMARY: Three Iranian individuals and one entity were sanctioned for supplying drones used by Russia in Ukraine.
TEXT: EU sanctions Iranian drone suppliers: Three Iranian individuals and one entity were sanctioned for supplying drones used by Russia in Ukraine.

HEADLINE: EU adds sanctions violations as EU crime
SUMMARY: The EU classified sanctions violations as EU crimes to improve enforcement and deter circumvention.
TEXT: EU adds sanctions violations as EU crime: The EU classified sanctions violations as EU crimes to improve enforcement and deter circumvention.

HEADLINE: EU agrees on Russian oil price cap
SUMMARY: The EU set a $60 per barrel price cap on Russian crude oil to reduce revenue funding the war.
TEXT: EU agrees on Russian oil price cap: The EU set a $60 per barrel price cap on Russian crude oil to reduce revenue funding the war.

HEADLINE: Ninth package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU imposed bans on drone engines, dual-use exports, mining investments, services, sanctioned additional individuals and entities, and suspended Russian media licenses.
TEXT: Ninth package of sanctions against Russia: The EU imposed bans on drone engines, dual-use exports, mining investments, services, sanctioned additional individuals and entities, and suspended Russian media licenses.

HEADLINE: EU prolongs economic sanctions over Russias military aggression against Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Council extended sectoral economic sanctions against Russia for six months until 31 July 2023, covering key areas such as finance, energy, transport, and technology in response to Russias continued military aggression.
TEXT: EU prolongs economic sanctions over Russias military aggression against Ukraine: The Council extended sectoral economic sanctions against Russia for six months until 31 July 2023, covering key areas such as finance, energy, transport, and technology in response to Russias continued military aggression.

HEADLINE: EU agrees on level of price cap for Russian petroleum products
SUMMARY: The EU set price caps on Russian petroleum products under CN code 2710: USD 45 per barrel for products traded at a discount to crude oil and USD 100 per barrel for products traded at a premium, effective from 5 February 2023, in cooperation with the Price Cap Coalition.
TEXT: EU agrees on level of price cap for Russian petroleum products: The EU set price caps on Russian petroleum products under CN code 2710: USD 45 per barrel for products traded at a discount to crude oil and USD 100 per barrel for products traded at a premium, effective from 5 February 2023, in cooperation with the Price Cap Coalition.

HEADLINE: EU prolongs restrictions on business with non-government controlled areas of Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Council extended restrictive measures until 24 February 2024 against business activities with non-government controlled areas of Donetsk, Luhansk, Zaporizhzhia, and Kherson, including bans on imports, exports, and advisory services.
TEXT: EU prolongs restrictions on business with non-government controlled areas of Ukraine: The Council extended restrictive measures until 24 February 2024 against business activities with non-government controlled areas of Donetsk, Luhansk, Zaporizhzhia, and Kherson, including bans on imports, exports, and advisory services.

HEADLINE: 10th package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU adopted the tenth sanctions package including bans on exports of critical technology, imports of asphalt and synthetic rubber, gas storage provision, and transit of dual-use goods, suspended RT Arabic and Sputnik Arabic broadcasting, and sanctioned 87 individuals and 34 entities.
TEXT: 10th package of sanctions against Russia: The EU adopted the tenth sanctions package including bans on exports of critical technology, imports of asphalt and synthetic rubber, gas storage provision, and transit of dual-use goods, suspended RT Arabic and Sputnik Arabic broadcasting, and sanctioned 87 individuals and 34 entities.

HEADLINE: EU renews individual sanctions over Russias military aggression against Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Council renewed individual restrictive measures until 15 September 2023, including travel bans, asset freezes, and funding prohibitions, applying to 1,473 individuals and 205 entities.
TEXT: EU renews individual sanctions over Russias military aggression against Ukraine: The Council renewed individual restrictive measures until 15 September 2023, including travel bans, asset freezes, and funding prohibitions, applying to 1,473 individuals and 205 entities.

HEADLINE: Wagner Group and RIA FAN added to the EU sanctions list
SUMMARY: The EU added the Wagner Group and RIA FAN to its sanctions list for undermining Ukraines sovereignty, bringing total sanctioned individuals to 1,473 and entities to 207, all subject to asset freezes and funding bans.
TEXT: Wagner Group and RIA FAN added to the EU sanctions list: The EU added the Wagner Group and RIA FAN to its sanctions list for undermining Ukraines sovereignty, bringing total sanctioned individuals to 1,473 and entities to 207, all subject to asset freezes and funding bans.

HEADLINE: 11th package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU adopted the eleventh sanctions package to counter circumvention, including tighter export restrictions, bans on transit of goods via Russia, enhanced cooperation with third countries, and sanctions on 71 individuals and 33 entities.
TEXT: 11th package of sanctions against Russia: The EU adopted the eleventh sanctions package to counter circumvention, including tighter export restrictions, bans on transit of goods via Russia, enhanced cooperation with third countries, and sanctions on 71 individuals and 33 entities.

HEADLINE: Information manipulation in Russias war against Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Council sanctioned seven individuals and five entities involved in the RRN digital information manipulation campaign, which used fake media websites and social media accounts to spread pro-Russian propaganda within the EU.
TEXT: Information manipulation in Russias war against Ukraine: The Council sanctioned seven individuals and five entities involved in the RRN digital information manipulation campaign, which used fake media websites and social media accounts to spread pro-Russian propaganda within the EU.

HEADLINE: 12th package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU adopted the twelfth sanctions package targeting high-value sectors, including a ban on Russian diamonds, stricter dual-use export controls, enforcement of oil price caps, prohibition of liquefied propane imports, and sanctions on an additional 61 individuals and 86 entities.
TEXT: 12th package of sanctions against Russia: The EU adopted the twelfth sanctions package targeting high-value sectors, including a ban on Russian diamonds, stricter dual-use export controls, enforcement of oil price caps, prohibition of liquefied propane imports, and sanctions on an additional 61 individuals and 86 entities.

HEADLINE: EU sanctions Russian diamond firm Alrosa
SUMMARY: The Council added PJSC Alrosa and its CEO to the EU sanctions list, in line with the diamond ban introduced in December 2023. Alrosa accounts for over 90% of Russian diamond production and provides significant revenue to the Russian government.
TEXT: EU sanctions Russian diamond firm Alrosa: The Council added PJSC Alrosa and its CEO to the EU sanctions list, in line with the diamond ban introduced in December 2023. Alrosa accounts for over 90% of Russian diamond production and provides significant revenue to the Russian government.

HEADLINE: Russia: EU imposes new sanctions over human rights violations
SUMMARY: The EU imposed sanctions on four individuals and one entity under the Global Human Rights Sanctions Regime for serious human rights violations, including arbitrary arrests and censorship practices linked to the Russian judicial system.
TEXT: Russia: EU imposes new sanctions over human rights violations: The EU imposed sanctions on four individuals and one entity under the Global Human Rights Sanctions Regime for serious human rights violations, including arbitrary arrests and censorship practices linked to the Russian judicial system.

HEADLINE: Council renews economic sanctions over Russias military aggression against Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Council extended sectoral economic sanctions against Russia for six months until 31 July 2024, covering finance, energy, transport, and technology sectors.
TEXT: Council renews economic sanctions over Russias military aggression against Ukraine: The Council extended sectoral economic sanctions against Russia for six months until 31 July 2024, covering finance, energy, transport, and technology sectors.

HEADLINE: Immobilised Russian assets: Council decides to set aside extraordinary revenues
SUMMARY: The Council decided that central securities depositories must separately account extraordinary revenues generated from immobilised Russian Central Bank assets, paving the way for future financial support to Ukraine.
TEXT: Immobilised Russian assets: Council decides to set aside extraordinary revenues: The Council decided that central securities depositories must separately account extraordinary revenues generated from immobilised Russian Central Bank assets, paving the way for future financial support to Ukraine.

HEADLINE: 13th package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU imposed restrictive measures on 106 individuals and 88 entities, targeting the military and defence sectors, judiciary members, and those responsible for the illegal deportation of Ukrainian children, along with new drone and export restrictions.
TEXT: 13th package of sanctions against Russia: The EU imposed restrictive measures on 106 individuals and 88 entities, targeting the military and defence sectors, judiciary members, and those responsible for the illegal deportation of Ukrainian children, along with new drone and export restrictions.

HEADLINE: EU renews individual sanctions over Russias war of aggression against Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Council prolonged individual sanctions until 15 September 2024, including asset freezes and travel bans, applying to over 2,100 individuals and entities linked to Russias aggression.
TEXT: EU renews individual sanctions over Russias war of aggression against Ukraine: The Council prolonged individual sanctions until 15 September 2024, including asset freezes and travel bans, applying to over 2,100 individuals and entities linked to Russias aggression.

HEADLINE: EU imposes new sanctions over death of Alexei Navalny
SUMMARY: The EU sanctioned 33 individuals and two entities under the Global Human Rights Sanctions Regime in response to the death of Alexei Navalny, including penal colonies, judiciary members, and penitentiary officials.
TEXT: EU imposes new sanctions over death of Alexei Navalny: The EU sanctioned 33 individuals and two entities under the Global Human Rights Sanctions Regime in response to the death of Alexei Navalny, including penal colonies, judiciary members, and penitentiary officials.

HEADLINE: Council bans four Russian-controlled media outlets
SUMMARY: The Council suspended broadcasting of Voice of Europe, RIA Novosti, Izvestia, and Rossiyskaya Gazeta for spreading Russian propaganda and disinformation supporting the war against Ukraine.
TEXT: Council bans four Russian-controlled media outlets: The Council suspended broadcasting of Voice of Europe, RIA Novosti, Izvestia, and Rossiyskaya Gazeta for spreading Russian propaganda and disinformation supporting the war against Ukraine.

HEADLINE: EU to use profits from frozen Russian assets to help Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Council approved the use of windfall net profits generated from immobilised Russian assets to support Ukraines defence, reconstruction, and recovery through EU programmes.
TEXT: EU to use profits from frozen Russian assets to help Ukraine: The Council approved the use of windfall net profits generated from immobilised Russian assets to support Ukraines defence, reconstruction, and recovery through EU programmes.

HEADLINE: EU sets up new sanctions framework targeting human rights violations in Russia
SUMMARY: The EU established a country-specific sanctions regime targeting serious human rights violations in Russia, sanctioning 19 individuals and one entity and introducing trade restrictions on repression-related equipment.
TEXT: EU sets up new sanctions framework targeting human rights violations in Russia: The EU established a country-specific sanctions regime targeting serious human rights violations in Russia, sanctioning 19 individuals and one entity and introducing trade restrictions on repression-related equipment.

HEADLINE: EU imposes new sanctions in response to information manipulation
SUMMARY: The Council sanctioned two individuals and one entity, including Voice of Europe, for propaganda and information manipulation supporting Russias war against Ukraine.
TEXT: EU imposes new sanctions in response to information manipulation: The Council sanctioned two individuals and one entity, including Voice of Europe, for propaganda and information manipulation supporting Russias war against Ukraine.

HEADLINE: Crimea and Sevastopol: Council renews sanctions for a further year
SUMMARY: The EU renewed sanctions related to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol until 23 June 2025, maintaining restrictions on trade, investment, tourism, and energy activities.
TEXT: Crimea and Sevastopol: Council renews sanctions for a further year: The EU renewed sanctions related to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol until 23 June 2025, maintaining restrictions on trade, investment, tourism, and energy activities.

HEADLINE: 14th package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU adopted comprehensive sanctions targeting energy, finance, trade, LNG transshipment, financial messaging systems, aviation, and political funding, and sanctioned 69 individuals and 47 entities.
TEXT: 14th package of sanctions against Russia: The EU adopted comprehensive sanctions targeting energy, finance, trade, LNG transshipment, financial messaging systems, aviation, and political funding, and sanctioned 69 individuals and 47 entities.

HEADLINE: EU imposes new individual sanctions on Russia
SUMMARY: The Council sanctioned two individuals and four entities for circumventing EU sanctions and materially supporting the Russian government, imposing asset freezes and travel bans.
TEXT: EU imposes new individual sanctions on Russia: The Council sanctioned two individuals and four entities for circumventing EU sanctions and materially supporting the Russian government, imposing asset freezes and travel bans.

HEADLINE: EU renews economic sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The Council extended economic sanctions against Russia for six months until 31 January 2025 in response to continued destabilising actions in Ukraine.
TEXT: EU renews economic sanctions against Russia: The Council extended economic sanctions against Russia for six months until 31 January 2025 in response to continued destabilising actions in Ukraine.

HEADLINE: EU renews individual sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The Council prolonged individual restrictive measures until 15 March 2025, including asset freezes, travel bans, and funding prohibitions.
TEXT: EU renews individual sanctions against Russia: The Council prolonged individual restrictive measures until 15 March 2025, including asset freezes, travel bans, and funding prohibitions.

HEADLINE: EU adopts new sanctions regime in response to hybrid threats from Russia
SUMMARY: The EU established a new framework to counter hybrid threats such as election interference, cyberattacks, sabotage, disinformation, and the instrumentalisation of migrants.
TEXT: EU adopts new sanctions regime in response to hybrid threats from Russia: The EU established a new framework to counter hybrid threats such as election interference, cyberattacks, sabotage, disinformation, and the instrumentalisation of migrants.

HEADLINE: 15th package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU adopted the fifteenth sanctions package, including sanctions on 54 individuals and 30 entities, bans on shadow fleet vessels, expanded dual-use export restrictions, legal enforcement bans, and extended divestment derogations.
TEXT: 15th package of sanctions against Russia: The EU adopted the fifteenth sanctions package, including sanctions on 54 individuals and 30 entities, bans on shadow fleet vessels, expanded dual-use export restrictions, legal enforcement bans, and extended divestment derogations.

HEADLINE: EU agrees first listings in response to Russias hybrid threats
SUMMARY: The Council imposed restrictive measures on 16 individuals and three entities responsible for Russias destabilising hybrid activities, including coordinated information manipulation and interference.
TEXT: EU agrees first listings in response to Russias hybrid threats: The Council imposed restrictive measures on 16 individuals and three entities responsible for Russias destabilising hybrid activities, including coordinated information manipulation and interference.

HEADLINE: EU renews economic sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The Council renewed EU economic restrictive measures against Russia for six months until 31 July 2025 due to Russias continued actions destabilising Ukraine.
TEXT: EU renews economic sanctions against Russia: The Council renewed EU economic restrictive measures against Russia for six months until 31 July 2025 due to Russias continued actions destabilising Ukraine.

HEADLINE: 16th package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU adopted the 16th sanctions package, imposing measures on 48 individuals and 35 entities, expanding shadow fleet vessel bans, financial messaging restrictions, export controls on dual-use and energy goods, media suspensions, flight bans, port bans, and additional restrictions on Crimea, Sevastopol, and occupied Ukrainian regions.
TEXT: 16th package of sanctions against Russia: The EU adopted the 16th sanctions package, imposing measures on 48 individuals and 35 entities, expanding shadow fleet vessel bans, financial messaging restrictions, export controls on dual-use and energy goods, media suspensions, flight bans, port bans, and additional restrictions on Crimea, Sevastopol, and occupied Ukrainian regions.

HEADLINE: New tariffs on agricultural products and fertilisers from Russia and Belarus
SUMMARY: The Council adopted its negotiating position on tariffs for remaining agricultural products and nitrogen-based fertilisers from Russia and Belarus to reduce export revenues funding the war.
TEXT: New tariffs on agricultural products and fertilisers from Russia and Belarus: The Council adopted its negotiating position on tariffs for remaining agricultural products and nitrogen-based fertilisers from Russia and Belarus to reduce export revenues funding the war.

HEADLINE: EU renews individual sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: Individual sanctions targeting those undermining Ukraines territorial integrity were prolonged for six months until 15 September 2025.
TEXT: EU renews individual sanctions against Russia: Individual sanctions targeting those undermining Ukraines territorial integrity were prolonged for six months until 15 September 2025.

HEADLINE: 17th package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU adopted the 17th sanctions package, targeting 17 individuals and 58 entities, banning port access for 189 shadow fleet vessels, expanding dual-use export restrictions, and restricting goods contributing to Russias military and technological capacity.
TEXT: 17th package of sanctions against Russia: The EU adopted the 17th sanctions package, targeting 17 individuals and 58 entities, banning port access for 189 shadow fleet vessels, expanding dual-use export restrictions, and restricting goods contributing to Russias military and technological capacity.

HEADLINE: New sanctions in response to hybrid threats from Russia
SUMMARY: The Council imposed sanctions on 21 individuals and six entities for destabilising hybrid activities, expanded scope to target tangible assets, and enabled suspension of Russian media broadcasting licences.
TEXT: New sanctions in response to hybrid threats from Russia: The Council imposed sanctions on 21 individuals and six entities for destabilising hybrid activities, expanded scope to target tangible assets, and enabled suspension of Russian media broadcasting licences.

HEADLINE: New sanctions in view of human rights violations in Russia
SUMMARY: The EU sanctioned 28 individuals, mainly judiciary members, responsible for serious human rights violations, repression of opposition, and persecution linked to Alexei Navalny.
TEXT: New sanctions in view of human rights violations in Russia: The EU sanctioned 28 individuals, mainly judiciary members, responsible for serious human rights violations, repression of opposition, and persecution linked to Alexei Navalny.
