HEADLINE: New sanctions over the use of chemical weapons by Russian forces in Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Council sanctioned three Russian Armed Forces entities involved in the development and use of chemical weapons, following OPCW reports confirming use of riot control agents in Ukraine.
TEXT: New sanctions over the use of chemical weapons by Russian forces in Ukraine: The Council sanctioned three Russian Armed Forces entities involved in the development and use of chemical weapons, following OPCW reports confirming use of riot control agents in Ukraine.

HEADLINE: EU renews sanctions over human rights abuses in Russia
SUMMARY: The EU extended its human rights sanctions framework targeting repression, civil society abuse, and rule of law violations in Russia until 28 May 2026.
TEXT: EU renews sanctions over human rights abuses in Russia: The EU extended its human rights sanctions framework targeting repression, civil society abuse, and rule of law violations in Russia until 28 May 2026.

HEADLINE: New tariffs on agricultural products and fertilisers from Russia and Belarus
SUMMARY: The Council adopted a regulation imposing new tariffs on agricultural goods and fertilisers from Russia and Belarus to reduce export revenues financing the war.
TEXT: New tariffs on agricultural products and fertilisers from Russia and Belarus: The Council adopted a regulation imposing new tariffs on agricultural goods and fertilisers from Russia and Belarus to reduce export revenues financing the war.

HEADLINE: Crimea and Sevastopol: EU renews sanctions for a further year
SUMMARY: Sanctions related to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol were renewed until 23 June 2026.
TEXT: Crimea and Sevastopol: EU renews sanctions for a further year: Sanctions related to the illegal annexation of Crimea and Sevastopol were renewed until 23 June 2026.

HEADLINE: EU renews economic sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The Council renewed EU economic restrictive measures for six months until 31 January 2026 due to Russias continued destabilising actions in Ukraine.
TEXT: EU renews economic sanctions against Russia: The Council renewed EU economic restrictive measures for six months until 31 January 2026 due to Russias continued destabilising actions in Ukraine.

HEADLINE: New sanctions in response to hybrid threats from Russia
SUMMARY: The Council sanctioned nine individuals and six entities involved in destabilising hybrid actions undermining EU security and integrity.
TEXT: New sanctions in response to hybrid threats from Russia: The Council sanctioned nine individuals and six entities involved in destabilising hybrid actions undermining EU security and integrity.

HEADLINE: New sanctions in response to human rights abuses in Russia
SUMMARY: The EU imposed sanctions on five individuals, mainly judiciary members, responsible for serious human rights abuses and persecution of activist Alexei Gorinov.
TEXT: New sanctions in response to human rights abuses in Russia: The EU imposed sanctions on five individuals, mainly judiciary members, responsible for serious human rights abuses and persecution of activist Alexei Gorinov.

HEADLINE: 18th package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU adopted the 18th sanctions package, lowering the oil price cap, banning refined petroleum imports from Russian crude, imposing full transaction bans on Nord Stream 1 and 2, expanding shadow fleet bans, financial messaging bans, and export restrictions.
TEXT: 18th package of sanctions against Russia: The EU adopted the 18th sanctions package, lowering the oil price cap, banning refined petroleum imports from Russian crude, imposing full transaction bans on Nord Stream 1 and 2, expanding shadow fleet bans, financial messaging bans, and export restrictions.

HEADLINE: EU renews individual sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The Council prolonged individual sanctions targeting those undermining Ukraines sovereignty for six months until 15 March 2026.
TEXT: EU renews individual sanctions against Russia: The Council prolonged individual sanctions targeting those undermining Ukraines sovereignty for six months until 15 March 2026.

HEADLINE: EU renews sanctions in response to Russian hybrid threats
SUMMARY: Sanctions against those responsible for Russias destabilising hybrid actions were extended by one year until 9 October 2026.
TEXT: EU renews sanctions in response to Russian hybrid threats: Sanctions against those responsible for Russias destabilising hybrid actions were extended by one year until 9 October 2026.

HEADLINE: 19th package of sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The EU adopted the 19th sanctions package, targeting energy, LNG imports, shadow fleet vessels, banks, payment systems, crypto providers, export controls, diplomatic travel obligations, and additional sanctions against Belarus.
TEXT: 19th package of sanctions against Russia: The EU adopted the 19th sanctions package, targeting energy, LNG imports, shadow fleet vessels, banks, payment systems, crypto providers, export controls, diplomatic travel obligations, and additional sanctions against Belarus.

HEADLINE: New sanctions in response to human rights abuses in Russia
SUMMARY: The EU sanctioned ten additional individuals, including judiciary and penitentiary officials, responsible for repression and human rights violations linked to Navalny and civil society.
TEXT: New sanctions in response to human rights abuses in Russia: The EU sanctioned ten additional individuals, including judiciary and penitentiary officials, responsible for repression and human rights violations linked to Navalny and civil society.

HEADLINE: New sanctions against Russias shadow fleet
SUMMARY: The Council sanctioned five individuals and four entities supporting Russias shadow fleet and its value chain to curb revenue generation.
TEXT: New sanctions against Russias shadow fleet: The Council sanctioned five individuals and four entities supporting Russias shadow fleet and its value chain to curb revenue generation.

HEADLINE: New sanctions in response to Russian hybrid threats
SUMMARY: The EU imposed sanctions on 12 individuals and two entities for hybrid activities including information manipulation and cyber attacks against the EU.
TEXT: New sanctions in response to Russian hybrid threats: The EU imposed sanctions on 12 individuals and two entities for hybrid activities including information manipulation and cyber attacks against the EU.

HEADLINE: EU sanctions more vessels in Russias shadow fleet
SUMMARY: The Council sanctioned 41 additional vessels from Russias shadow fleet, imposing port access bans and maritime service prohibitions.
TEXT: EU sanctions more vessels in Russias shadow fleet: The Council sanctioned 41 additional vessels from Russias shadow fleet, imposing port access bans and maritime service prohibitions.

HEADLINE: EU renews economic sanctions against Russia
SUMMARY: The Council renewed EU economic sanctions for six months until 31 July 2026 in response to Russias continued destabilisation of Ukraine.
TEXT: EU renews economic sanctions against Russia: The Council renewed EU economic sanctions for six months until 31 July 2026 in response to Russias continued destabilisation of Ukraine.

HEADLINE: New sanctions in response to human rights abuses in Russia
SUMMARY: The EU imposed sanctions on two members of the Russian judiciary responsible for serious human rights violations and repression of democratic opposition.
TEXT: New sanctions in response to human rights abuses in Russia: The EU imposed sanctions on two members of the Russian judiciary responsible for serious human rights violations and repression of democratic opposition.
